chargeHist.descr: Misuse of GPS Device - place without consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Spencer Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Misuse of GPS Device - place without consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.315(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with SB. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. Defendant to avoid social media accounts of Victims.   Mental health evaluation and treatment as deemed appropriate by the Agent. Maintain part time work. Submit to DNA analysis. If Agent deems probationary needs have been met can petition for early termination.
